awd_titl_txt: US-China Cooperative Research:  Atomic Processes In Muon-   Catalyzed Fusion
awd_abstract_narration: This is a two-year collaborative research project between                       Dr. Chii Dong Lin, Kansas State University and Professors                       Bao Cheng-Guang, Zhongshan University and Liu Xian-Hui,                         Institute of High Energy Physics, Academia Sinica, to study                     atomic fusion.  The atomic fusion processes are important                       in the study of high energy physics.  The data derived from                     this study can be useful in energy development.  The U. S.                      P.I. is an expert in the field of hyperspherical coordinates                    research, while the Chinese collaborators have developed                        methods for dealing with hyperspherical harmonic functions.                     Both techniques are needed for understanding atomic fusion.                     The research is mutually beneficial and can advance this                        field of research.
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering

pgm_ele.pgm_ele_name: US CHINA COOP IN BASIC SCIENCE
